conclusion: Determine the heat Q exchanged between the gas and the environment during the process from state A to state C.
Determine the initial and final temperatures using the ideal gas law and the given temperature at point A.
Calculate the work done by the gas in each step of the process.
Use the first law of thermodynamics to find the heat exchanged.
Temperature at state A is -73°C, converted to Kelvin: T_A = 200 K.
Use ideal gas law to find temperature at state C: T_C = 66.67 K.
State C has pressure 1 atm (100 kPa) and volume 4 × 10⁻³ m³.
Work done from A to B (constant pressure) is 900 J.
Work done from B to C (constant volume) is 0 J.
Use first law of thermodynamics: Q = -700 J.
Heat exchanged between gas and environment is -700 J.
